verb.description: Fill (a balloon, tire, or other expandable structure) with air or gas so that it becomes distended.
Increase (something) by a large or excessive amount.
examples: objectives should be clearly set out so as not to duplicate work and inflate costs

verb.description: Bring about inflation of (a currency) or in (an economy).

origin: Late Middle English: from Latin inflat- blown into, from the verb inflare, from in- into + flare to blow.
